Title: Operational Support Administrator
FullDescriptions:
OptaSense is a world leader in Distributed Acoustic Sensing and proud to provide vital information to help protect and secure the world's critical assets.

Drawing on decades of experience in the signal processing world, OptaSense is able to turn standard single mode telecoms fibre into a listening device up to 50km in length. OptaSense is rapidly expanding, with growth built on providing cutting edge solutions and excellent service to clients with security and monitoring requirements in tough environments. The OptaSense system has been deployed successfully worldwide and we now have operations in over 35 countries, in industries such as Oil and Gas, Transport and Security.

Join a challenging, dynamic and fast growing business with an exciting portfolio of international clients working on some of the most critical and exciting projects around the planet.

OptaSense, Inc. is an equal opportunity and affirmative action employer. All qualified applicants will receive consideration for employment and will not be discriminated against on the basis of disability or protected veteran status.

Job description/Person specification
Role Purpose
OptaSense (a division of QinetiQ) is looking for a Operational Support Administrator to join our dynamic team. We operate in various field locations throughout the US and Canada, as well as worldwide. This position will be located in Houston, Texas.

This position reports to the Operations Manager and support a key role within OptaSense Oilfield Services (OFS) as well as support the ISM business.
The Operational Support Administrator role will include being responsible for domestic and international shipping and receiving, everything from vehicles, equipment, and parts, to paper reports for all international OptaSense and customer locations. The Operational Support Administrator role is also responsible for coordinating between OFS & ISM operations, technical leads and the final customer for acquisition and delivery projects. The role will be to ensure scheduling and timing of equipment and ensuring field crews meet project timelines and requirements. The role is also responsible for working with Commercial, Financial and Operational teams in preparing and project invoicing.

Strong communication, teamwork and leadership skills are a must as this position requires frequent communication with all areas of the company and with customers. This position works with the company’s key customers, which makes client-facing skills essential to the position. The ability to work independently under minimal supervision and strong organizational and planning skills are also a must for this position.

Key Accountabilities

Manage daily shipping and distribution operations, ensuring orders are prepared, complete, shipped and delivered in a timely manner.
Tracking inbound and outbound packages and compliance with all customs regulations for destination and receiving countries.
Build relationships with external suppliers, maintenance shops and regulatory bodies.
Manage all important documents such as advanced shipping notice, pick slips, bills of lading etc.
Well organized and excels in communication. Must be comfortable with paperwork and information systems and have functioning knowledge of shipping and receiving procedures; to include worldwide international shipping requirements.
The goal is to ensure that the shipping processes are running smoothly and effectively, resolving issues with orders efficiently.
Perform quality checks on all received and shipped goods.
Operate material handling equipment, i.e. forklift and pallet jack (training provided).
Conduct daily forklift inspections and communicate any material handling equipment issues to line management.
Maintain a safe, clean and well-organized working environment.
Continuously monitor effectiveness of shop facilities and cleaning, ensuring standards are followed and met.
Adhere to all safety policies and procedures. (please refer to QHSE section)
Use SAP to create and issue Purchase Orders for the Operations department.
Assist in data entry into SAP for Operations.
Manage the field personnel air travel and flight booking as requested by Operations.
Other Operational Support administration needs
Working with the Projects Team provide liaison around project resourcing issues and requirements, working with the Operations Managers
Prior to an engineer’s deployment and working with the Projects Team, prepare pre-deployment paperwork, including Task Definition Document, Security Risk Assessment, Travel Details.
Following deployment provide support in the follow up of post deployment paperwork including: Timesheets, Site Visit Reports, Software Versions, Allowance Claims, all being filed in the appropriate areas or forwarded to the Projects Team.
Record engineers Training and refresher training for HEFAT, Medicals, Offshore Training, First Aid Training, and other associated training requirements.
Act as primary focal point for Services Support Roster assignment, setting up and running the Services roster on a weekly basis for both Duty & Standby Engineers
Setup and Manage Services Contract database ensuring all Contracted Services have been recorded and are managed in terms of site visits or dial in services, including both monthly or yearly requirements.
Following the issuing of a new Services Contract provide to client a Welcome pack which includes Services Contract details and Service contact information.
Working with the Regional Operations Managers, keep check and stock of required PPE equipment and ordering as appropriate through SAP to maintain sufficient levels.
Maintain the Training Room (Houston) so that it is presentable and stocked with all requirements to provide training at short notice including equipment and stationary.
Act as Service Coordinator for repair and returns of failed units, working closely with the Project Team and the Portishead business to process returns promptly and efficiently.
Assisting the Operations Manager with the production and maintenance of the project record. Adding new projects and ensuring the necessary fields are completed.
Assisting the Operations Manager with the production and maintenance of the schedule. This includes the recording of deployments, leave and field equipment locations.

Qualifications

Completion of a high school diploma.
Valid Driver’s License required.
Valid forklift certification would be an asset.
Experience with Temporary Import Bonds.
Overseas shipment experience.
3-5 years of administrative experience
2-3 years of experience as a Receiver/Shipper; familiarity with the Oil and Gas Service Industry would be an asset.
Excellent communication skills (spoken, written & interpersonal).
Strong computer literacy with working knowledge of Microsoft Office Environment and the ability to learn new software quickly.
SAP experience would be an asset.
Strong organizational and planning skills.
Positive attitude with the ability to work in teams as well as independently.
Proactive self-starter.

Take all reasonable care to protect the health and safety of themselves, their co-workers and any other persons who may be affected by our daily activities. Use due diligence to reduce the risk of incidents.

Report all injuries and incidents immediately to Line Manager or QHSE Department.
Participate in the near-miss reporting and hazard reporting program.
Understand, know, & follow all policies, procedures and work instructions given by management.
Adhere to the Right-to-Refuse Policy; alert line management to conditions in which mitigations haven’t covered all safety aspects prior to beginning task.
Be sure all PPE is fit for purpose, donning it when required.
Adhere to the OptaSense Behavior Safety Program as well as to all client rules as applicable.
Participate in the QHSE program and follow all regulations.
Practice environmental stewardship by minimizing waste, reporting and cleaning up all trash and spills.
Communicate with management and co-workers about hazards, ideas, and concerns, to ensure continuous improvement.
Participate and or conduct safety meetings and or tailgate meetings at the worksite as required.
Conduct yourself in a professional manner at all times.
Conform to the company Drug and Alcohol Policy and be fit for duty.

EEO Employer/Vets/Disabled

Title: Operations Coordinator
Responsibilities:
Program coordination & customer engagement (60%)
Business development support (20%)
General operations/business administration (10%)
Recordkeeping/compliance (10%)
FullDescriptions:
Greenroads Foundation (www.greenroads.org) seeks an experienced Operations Coordinator for a full-time role. As Operations Coordinator, your job is to ensure that our people, programs, products, policies, processes, and places are organized and functioning seamlessly together in support of the mission and vision of the organization.

As Operations Coordinator, you are a deliberate and skilled administrator with a learn by doing attitude. You have great timing, rhythm, pace, and powerful attention management skills so you don't miss a beat. You like to finish things and always follow-up. You can organize and execute multiple projects as well as ongoing routine tasks while keeping a cool head. You are a systems-thinker and dot-connector. You are a MacGyver of meeting logistics. You find zen in clean and tidy databases. Everything runs smoothly because of you. You live for clear goals, roles, and procedures. You make sure that the burden of work is equally shared and effectively supported. You help identify and close gaps in policies and processes. You are a stickler for the highest quality even when juggling multiple deadlines and deliverables in an environment of multiple competing priorities. You enjoy creating and maintaining positive user experiences and helping others solve problems.

As an employee, you are choosing to become a daily representative of Greenroads and its mission to benefit communities and the environment by recognizing sustainable transportation projects and promoting sustainability education for transportation infrastructure around the world.

Critical Responsibilities

Program coordination & customer engagement (60%)
Business development support (20%)
General operations/business administration (10%)
Recordkeeping/compliance (10%)
Common projects and tasks include:

Assist the CEO and the Board of Directors in day-to-day coordination and management of business operational activities, including the Project Rating Program, Education Program, and Membership Program.
Schedule, coordinate, prepare, and organize multiple routine and complex tasks, including meetings and events
Maintain multiple databases and organization's administrative records
Organize schedules and staff resources for long term projects like program development, contract management, product development, and customer service.
Support and organize resources for business routines including recruitment cycles for volunteers and program development campaigns
Provide general customer support by phone and email to meet customer expectations and business goals
Monitoring and maintaining internal and external program policies and helping to enforce them
Research and prepare policy and procedures documents for our Project Rating, Education and Membership programs.
Performing other projects as assigned
Must-Haves

4-8 years of professional experience in administration, operations, customer support, organizing people
Bachelor's degree in business, psychology, anthropology, or policy or similar.
Prior experience in nonprofit program administration, business operations, database administration
Prior experience in customer service, sales, human resources
Strong relationship building, writing, and conversational skills
Comfortable with iterative work, receiving direct feedback, and rapidly changing priorities/deadlines
Understanding of our market sector and customers (engineering, urban planning, construction, government, transportation)
Outcome goal and process-oriented attitude
Ridiculous attention to detail about facts and figures
Excellent communication skills in person, on the phone and in writing
Scheduling, coordinating, and organizing multiple complex tasks
Ridiculous attention to detail about relationships and people
Negotiation or contract management skills
Strong drive for learning by doing and information seeking
Professional, respectful and positive attitude
Nice-to-Haves

Greenroads STP Level 1 Credential
CRM tool experience
Information gathering and research experience
Prior experience with business management reporting tools, business technology and software applications
Prompt, accurate, and quality oriented
Proactive, sense of ownership, can work independently and self-sufficiently
Nonprofit experience
Affinity/experience with sustainability, transportation, civil engineering, construction or infrastructure
Enjoy supporting a team in your area of expertise
Supervision

You will report directly to the CEO. You will interact and cooperate directly with past and current Project Teams, Members, Sustainable Transportation Professionals, and our vendors and contractors.

This position does not have direct reports. This position will support and may occasionally supervise volunteers, including our volunteer board of directors and technical advisory councils.

Working Conditions

Open-plan desk in a collaborative space
We are open to alternative arrangements if the right candidate requires reasonable accommodations.
Physical Demands

Desk work
Occasional long or non-routine hours, including off-site events
Other Position Details

Non-exempt, regular, at-will employment
Introductory period of 3 months
Full-time employees are eligible for benefits including healthcare, wellness, and retirement after an introductory period
Flexible schedules and an amazing PTO policy
Primary Responsibilities in Your First Year of Service

Each staff role is intentionally designed as a intense learning experience in the beginning where you will develop knowledge and be able to apply it within your first year. We expect you to arrive not fully formed, ready to learn by doing and ready to work hard. In your first 90 days, your job is committing to learning the product, programs, and the role. In the first year, your job is to demonstrate you can effectively and reliably execute the essential duties of your role.

Career Path(s)

We are committed to providing creative and self-directed individuals with a variety of future opportunities for projects beyond their assigned tasks provided performance expectations are met.

The Coordinator level is the mid-level role at Greenroads, with the primary responsibility of "do" after Assistant ("learn") and Associate ("help"). The conventional job progression for this role over several years is Operations Coordinator (execution) -> Operations Specialist (build/lead projects and teams) -> Operations Manager (people management) -> COO/CEO (strategic)

Application Instructions

Please include your these materials with your application:

Copy of individual’s résumé or curriculum vitae
Cover letter that addresses 1) applicant’s personal and career goals, and 2) how working at Greenroads would help the applicant meet those goals, 3) anything else the applicant is willing to share
We do not accept email, phone, or in person applications. We will not respond to incomplete applications.

Our Process

Qualified applicants will be asked to complete one or more skills assessments/surveys, a 30-minute phone interview, and multiple in-person interviews prior our to selection of the next Greenroads team member. Our hiring process takes approximately 45-60 days.

The application will remain open until filled.

Title:
Operations Coordinator
Seeking a database administrator whose technical acumen and knowledge of databases will support LOGCAP Program Management Operations. Solely responsible for the development and maintenance of operation’s databases. Candidate will optimize project execution by overseeing operational databases and ensuring those databases meet the established standards for reliability, usability, and performance. Candidate must be a highly organized self-starter capable of working in a fast-paced, multi-discipline team environment with the ability to manage competing priorities to achieve goals.

Must have professional working knowledge with database administration to include but not limited to designing, building and implementing database systems
Responsible for the design and creation of data structures, upkeep of needed indices and refresh of the data warehouse used for running reports

Data migration/integration

Monitors, analyzes and resolves issues related to information flow and data architecture standards

Performs a wide range of administrative, office support, and coordination activities in support of the Program Management Office (PMO) Operations Department
Must be able to travel internationally to austere locations for extended periods and the successful candidate must meet KBR and Government mandated pre-deployment requirements including but not limited to: drug screening, medical screening, dental release, and criminal background check

Title: Operations Engineer II
FullDescriptions:
4+ years work experience in a systems administrator, engineering or technical IT/Cloud operations support role.Experience configuring, managing or troubleshooting systems of scale (cloud, virtualization, distributed networks, co-location.)Linux and/or Windows Operating System supportExperience in Networking (e.g. Deploying and troubleshooting LAN, VPN, Firewalls, TCP/IP etc.)Bachelors Degree or Equivalent work experience

Amazon’s technology business has a history and tradition of leading the world in Web-related technologies and services. Now, with Amazon Web Services (AWS) you have the chance to help individuals and businesses take their computing infrastructures and applications into “the Cloud”. As a member of the AWS Managed Services team you will be at the forefront of Cloud technologies, interacting with the full breadth of AWS services.

AWS Managed Services is designed to accelerate cloud adoption, it simplifies deployment, migration, and management using automation and machine learning, backed up by a dedicated team of Amazon employees. AWS Managed Services provides ongoing management of the AWS infrastructure. It automates common activities such as change requests, monitoring, patch management, security, and backup services, and provides full-lifecycle services to provision, run, and support your infrastructure.

We are looking for Operations Engineers to join our Managed Services team. This is an opportunity to join a world class team that is at the forefront of enhancing customer’s cloud support experience.

Let’s talk about you…
So, how’s your OS and networking skills? Do you have expertise in one or more of these areas?

Are you able to dive deep into ambiguous and undocumented technical issues, delivering a fix and accompanying process or improvements to your team?

Do you thrive in environments where your passion and interests enable you to understand the low-level details of the services and tools you use?

Do you naturally become a helpful resource amongst your peers – an individual that can be counted on to provide guidance and mentoring?

Are you getting excited after reading this?

We have Good news! We're building out a team of engineers with depth and experience across multiple technical domains, and you should be part of it. Come join us - we Work Hard, Have Fun and Make History!

AWS team membership
As a member of Managed Service team, this role will be working with our amazing Operation, Database, and Network Engineers to dive in and tackle the hardest technical challenges. The successful candidate will excel in an agile environment while collaborating with some of the smartest people in the industry. If you get excited about owning critical infrastructure services that serve global enterprise-scale customers every second of the day then this may be a great role for you! Every day will bring new and exciting challenges on the job. Day to Day things change but key goals are:

Operate the Managed Service platform and collaborate with internal service teams to meet our customers' individual needs for their infrastructure and application deployments.Troubleshoot complex issues, Drive root cause by re-producing customer issues, and build proof of concept environments that abide by cloud-best-practices.Collaborate and help build utilities and tools for internal use that enable you and AWS Engineers to operate safely at high speed and wide scale.Identify and drive improvements to technical processesAct as an escalation point and mentor to less experienced engineers on the team and across Amazon.Leverage your day-to-day experiences to provide the voice of the customer to internal AWS teams.Drive customer communication during critical events.Learn and leverage groundbreaking technologies.

Bachelor's degreeAWS experience with production workloadsExperience with service-oriented architecture and web servicesExperience with aspect(s) of security: network, application, security protocols, cryptography, etc...Experience with Configuration Management Software (we love Chef and Ansible, what about you?).Scripting and / or programming experience with at least one scripting language (PowerShell, Ruby, Python, Bash)Experience with IAM, Active Directory and ADFSExperience in a DevOps team, supporting CI/CD workloads.
Amazon is an Equal Opportunity-Affirmative Action Employer – Minority / Female / Disability / Veteran / Gender Identity / Sexual Orientation / Age

Title: Operations- Operations Mgmt & Strategy- Digital Transformation - Associate - Jersey City
FullDescriptions:
MORE ABOUT THIS JOB
OPERATIONS

Operations is a dynamic, multi-faceted division that partners with all parts of the firm to provide banking, securities, and asset management services to clients around the world. In addition, Operations provides essential risk management and controls to preserve and enhance the firm's assets and its reputation. For every new product launched and every trade executed, it is Operations that develops and manages the processes and controls that enable business flow.

A successful candidate would utilize his/her skills in BI infrastructure across the full enterprise data stack to provide a stable, well-tuned and managed data environment for BI professionals across the firm and work with Operations BI professionals to extract maximum value from this infrastructure to solve business problems. This includes responsibility for SQL databases functioning as data warehouses, ETL platforms, visualization platforms, data quality and master data platforms.

This individual will also be responsible for managing appropriate governance to ensure compliance with regulation, working to identify and eliminate barriers to progress in BI across teams, help teams improve the performance of their assets. In addition, him/her will need to stay aware of the current market and state of technology to keep our infra at a competitive level and partner with broader Digital Transformation to ensure that we can use this capability to accelerate reengineering across firm.
RESPONSIBILITIES AND QUALIFICATIONS
DESIRED SKILLS & EXPERIENCE

Technical
Preferred: Experience managing Viz deployments (Tableau; Power BI; Qlik)
Preferred: Experience or certification in database administration
Clear understanding of dev-ops in a BI Data-stack environment – including monitoring; management of change; incident and availability management
Demonstrated understanding of the full end-to-end enterprise data stack – from the data store; to ETL; data quality & master data; through to data warehouses and data engineering / modelling; and final consumption
Communications
Able to translate technical data capabilities to an operational audience
Demonstrate interpersonal skills and an ability to develop relationships with stakeholders
Articulate issues clearly and communicate effectively with all levels of the organization
Listen well and be receptive to others' ideas and suggestions, encouraging open and collaborative dialogue among team members
Client Focus
Identify client needs and appropriately work to understand the foundations of great client experience, while leveraging available internal tools to provide the best service possible
Establish, cultivate and leverage relationships to identify and execute on process enhancements
Risk Management
Articulate operational and risk impacts related to a specific task or procedure
Develop controls to proactively manage risks in this domain (e.g. entitlement; data proliferation control etc.)
Apply root cause analysis to identify opportunities for process improvements or work prioritization
Management, Leadership & Culture
Foster a culture of solving the firm’s problems and driving towards business value
Provide coaching & assistance where possible to other teams and organizational leaders to make better use of data and data assets
Ability to manage a plan across multiple competing priorities (multiple platforms, all of which will have different needs at different times)
PREFERRED QUALIFICATIONS
SQL Database Administrator
Tableau / Qliq / Power BI / Cognos environment manager
Experience in BI delivery through vendor platforms like Alteryx
Preferably ex-technology with 3-5 years experience in high velocity delivery
ABOUT GOLDMAN SACHS

Title: Order Administrator
FullDescriptions:
NTT America Overview:
NTT America, the driver of the North American efforts for the NTT Communications Group, is a global leader in enterprise cloud, data center, network and security services. We are the 2nd largest Telecom, Data Center Services Provider, and Global IP backbone in the world. NTTA has assisted small startups to Global Fortune 100 companies to extend their enterprise around the world, move, manage & secure their data and scale quickly in order to adapt to their business challenges and opportunities.
JOB SUMMARY:
The GIN Order Administrator supports and manages order processing and reporting for the GIN organization, including any support, training and process documentation.
DUTIES AND RESPONSIBILITIES:
Reviewing of customer contracts and processing of service orders, interacting with internal teams outside of Sales, and validating sales team booking performance.
Processing customer orders in systems in a timely manner and clearly communicating any issues or delays to effected sales reps and managers.
Prepares and conducts critical analysis on reports to ensure accuracy of data including tracking sales bookings, funnel metrics, and Salesforce.com. Create and run Salesforce reports on a regular basis to show performance, activity, data cleanliness compliance, etc.
Conduct quarterly review of documentation on the GIN dashboard (intranet). Delegate responsibility for reviewing and updating critical order processes and documentation by effectively communicating with internal teams.
Maintains customer orders and contracts in internal database.
Serves as point of contact and liaison for the order management team to internal departments and affiliate branches across the globe for order processing and reporting.
Point of contact for Salesforce.com. Provide assistance to field sales team to troubleshoot non-technical issues.
Develop and enhance presentations in PowerPoint and other tools to ensure quality and consistency.
Provides general administrative support to Order Admin Manager.
Ability to travel as needed to support GIN initiatives.
EXPERIENCE AND SKILL REQUIREMENTS:
Associate degree (A. A.) in Administration or related field preferred.
3+ years sales or sales support experience.
Excellent communication and interpersonal skills.
Ability to manage order processes.
Ability to create, to compose, and edit written material.
Ability to gather data, to compile information, and prepare reports.
Ability to handle sensitive customer and employee information with discretion and sound judgement.
Excellent organizational skills and attention to detail a must.
Demonstrates mutual acceptance and respect of all co-workers.
Ability to be a team player, works effectively with others with positive cooperation.
Ability to communicate, both internally and externally, in an effective, timely professional and courteous manner.
Strong computer skills, including MS Office; Word, Excel, PowerPoint and Outlook.
Experience using Salesforce.com.
All qualified applicants will receive consideration for employment without regard to race, religion, color, national origin, citizenship, sex, marital status, parental status, Pregnancy or maternity status, genetic information, sexual orientation, gender identity or expression, transgender status or reassignment, veteran's status, political affiliation, age or disability. Or any other status protected by applicable Federal, State or local law.
NTT America is an EEO Employer- Minorities/Women/Disabled/Veterans.

Title: Order Administrator
Qualifications:
Requires at least two plus years’ knowledge of SAP Sales Module.
Intermediate knowledge of applications and tools such as; Microsoft Word, Excel, Visio, and Power Point.
Good communication and telephone skills to relate and resolve specific order issues. Ability to act in authoritative role in meetings or OA related discussions.
Previous background should include knowledge of order management (database processing), as well as demonstrated ability to deal with other company personnel on customer order-related issues.
Needs to be able to react quickly in a fast-paced environment.
Solid SAP OM knowledge, Incoterms, driven individual, professional multi-tasker with extreme attention to detail. Able to prioritize workload, someone with superb time management skills
Responsibilities:
Receives orders submissions for new purchase orders, order changes, adjustments, and cancellations directly from both Field Sales and Product Division Representatives. Achieves and maintains rapport with internal and external customers and works to give them the best possible service.
Works on problems of diverse scope where analysis of data requires evaluation of identifiable factors. Exercises judgment within generally defined practices and policies in selecting methods and techniques for obtaining solutions.
Uses business computer and corporate databases to retrieve customer submission information, create and manage sales order activity and order status in a timely fashion. Ensures data integrity through complete entries and correct codes for retrieval by other KLA personnel.
Follows up on inquires by others for current status information based on the most recent submissions to Corporate Sales Operations. Performs entry follow-up through order entry review using standard and customer reports to ensure order accuracy.
Handles the order needs of sales representatives, customers, product divisions, and finance.
Works with Master Database manager and Finance to facilitate the Customer entry setup for orders for new customers.
Reviews submission documents to include, but not limited to: customer POs and change-orders, related documents, agreements, and supporting documentation to ensure compliance with Corporate Systems Booking Policy while maintaining complete and accurate backlog representation.
Maintains customer files of active orders, posting activity such as change notices, current order status reports, supporting documents, and related email necessary for complete explanations.
Participates in weekly divisional meetings pertaining to order status.
Willing and fast learner for additional and changing databases required to support processing activities at KLA (i.e.: quotation/order summaries, electronic data storage, and other sales-support systems as needed).
Team player attitude.
Concentrated support and work commitment during peak activities, such as at the end of corporate fiscal periods.
Administrative assistance to contract review process and storage, i.e. tracking, copying, stamping, filing, etc.
FullDescriptions:
Job Opening ID: 120656
Milpitas, CA, United States
Full-Time
Regular
Company Overview
Calling the adventurers ready to join a company that's pushing the limits of nanotechnology to keep the digital revolution rolling. At KLA, we're making technology advancements that are bigger—and tinier—than the world has ever seen.

Who are we? We research, develop, and manufacture the world's most advanced inspection and measurement equipment for the semiconductor and nanoelectronics industries. We enable the digital age by pushing the boundaries of technology, creating tools capable of finding defects smaller than a wavelength of visible light. We create smarter processes so that technology leaders can manufacture high-performance chips—the kind in that phone in your pocket, the tablet on your desk and nearly every electronic device you own—faster and better. We're passionate about creating solutions that drive progress and help people do what wouldn't be possible without us. The future is calling. Will you answer?
Group/Division
KLA is well known for its high-performing business model which routinely produces significant profit margins and revenue. Key to supporting KLA business is the finance team that partners with corporate and global business organizations to provide expertise and guidance for developing and executing sound business models and practices.
The Finance organization consists of operations and corporate finance teams. The operations finance team influences business decisions by gathering the best available operations information, distilling it and making recommendations to our management team on the best course of action. The corporate team provides a broad range of services, such as financial planning, corporate accounting, tax, industry analysis and benchmarking, internal audits, SEC reporting and merger and acquisition support.
Responsibilities
The Order Administration Team resides within the Sales Operations - Corporate Financial organization and is responsible for the timely and accurate booking and processing of customer received orders. The team works with Sales, Finance, Manufacturing, Marketing and Service organizations to ensure complete delivery of the required products and services offered by KLA.
JOB SUMMARY:
Performs all order administration responsibilities for assigned division(s), territories, Field Sales offices, or designated customers using related system and personnel resources. Handles sales order processing and data coordination for new purchase orders (POs) and change-order submissions, returns, and overall backlog management. Interfaces with field and factory personnel including Field Sales (Account Management and Sales Administrators), Division Slot Planning, Configuration Analysts, Trade Services, Shipping, Finance (Corporate and Division), as well as Divisional Marketing and Sales. May be assigned special projects or tasks by OA management.
ESSENTIAL FUNCTIONS:
Receives orders submissions for new purchase orders, order changes, adjustments, and cancellations directly from both Field Sales and Product Division Representatives. Achieves and maintains rapport with internal and external customers and works to give them the best possible service.
Works on problems of diverse scope where analysis of data requires evaluation of identifiable factors. Exercises judgment within generally defined practices and policies in selecting methods and techniques for obtaining solutions.
Uses business computer and corporate databases to retrieve customer submission information, create and manage sales order activity and order status in a timely fashion. Ensures data integrity through complete entries and correct codes for retrieval by other KLA personnel.
Follows up on inquires by others for current status information based on the most recent submissions to Corporate Sales Operations. Performs entry follow-up through order entry review using standard and customer reports to ensure order accuracy.
Handles the order needs of sales representatives, customers, product divisions, and finance.
Works with Master Database manager and Finance to facilitate the Customer entry setup for orders for new customers.
Reviews submission documents to include, but not limited to: customer POs and change-orders, related documents, agreements, and supporting documentation to ensure compliance with Corporate Systems Booking Policy while maintaining complete and accurate backlog representation.
Maintains customer files of active orders, posting activity such as change notices, current order status reports, supporting documents, and related email necessary for complete explanations.
Participates in weekly divisional meetings pertaining to order status.
Willing and fast learner for additional and changing databases required to support processing activities at KLA (i.e.: quotation/order summaries, electronic data storage, and other sales-support systems as needed).
Team player attitude.
Concentrated support and work commitment during peak activities, such as at the end of corporate fiscal periods.
Administrative assistance to contract review process and storage, i.e. tracking, copying, stamping, filing, etc.
RESPONSIBILITY AND AUTHORITY:
Equipment and work area: Reasonable care and operation of standard office equipment such as business computer, printers, and copiers.
Customer documents: Retrieve and maintain accurate records in a timely fashion to ensure customer satisfaction, and to allow others relying on this data to do the same.
Business contacts: Responsible for maintaining good Field and Factory relationships. Generally, deals with sales office and product division personnel, various levels of finance as well as support counterparts in Corporate Sales Operations in Systems and Information Technology.
Work level: Limited-to-minimal supervision, being mostly self-sufficient as an experienced Order Administrator, familiar with KLA resources and processes. Can assist others in more complex submission requirement situations. Would still work closely with OA Manager to coordinate and/or review projects, new processes, or unique and known situations. Should be able to easily represent OA processes and guidelines to others, as needed.
Projects: Handles additionally assigned responsibilities and special projects, as needed by OA management.
Supervisory support: May provide assistance to manager as needed in areas such as but not limited to new hire interviewing, OA training of new or existing employees or other department personnel, new system/process testing, and representation in assigned meetings.
ADDITIONAL RESPONSIBILITIES:
Performs other related duties as assigned.
Fully aware (based experience and in-house-training) of all order-related export requirements for international orders including but not limited to: Letters-of-Credit, VAT Tax issues, and Incoterms.
Can provide assistance in training others on current, or modified, process review through prepared presentation sessions based on OA Manager assignment or approval.
Qualifications
BA or BS is desired, but not required.
Requires at least two plus years’ knowledge of SAP Sales Module.
Intermediate knowledge of applications and tools such as; Microsoft Word, Excel, Visio, and Power Point.
Good communication and telephone skills to relate and resolve specific order issues. Ability to act in authoritative role in meetings or OA related discussions.
Previous background should include knowledge of order management (database processing), as well as demonstrated ability to deal with other company personnel on customer order-related issues.
Needs to be able to react quickly in a fast-paced environment.
Solid SAP OM knowledge, Incoterms, driven individual, professional multi-tasker with extreme attention to detail. Able to prioritize workload, someone with superb time management skills
Minimum Qualifications
Bachelor's Level Degree with at least 2 years of experience, or minimum 5 years of experience in SAP Sales systems.
Equal Employment Opportunity
KLA is an Equal Opportunity Employer. Applicants will be considered for employment without regard to age, race, color, religion, sex, sexual orientation, gender identity, national origin, protected veteran status, disability, or any other characteristics protected by applicable law.

Title: Orders Coordinator
FullDescriptions:
Job Title/Position: Orders Coordinator

Reports To: Administrator

JOB DESCRIPTION SUMMARY

Tracks and processes physicians' orders; primary person responsible for answering the agency's telephone lines.

ESSENTIAL JOB FUNCTIONS/RESPONSIBILITIES


Responsible for processing incomplete physicians' orders: scans to agency server, faxes to physician for completion, receives completed orders, and follows up with physicians for outstanding orders.
Maintains order tracking system to determine which orders have been completed and which remain outstanding.
Updates order status in Devero database from "pending" to "approved" after orders are processed and complete.
Reports on the number of orders processed and outstanding each week and as requested by the supervisor.
Travel to various physician offices as needed to obtain orders.
Files all completed orders and other medical record documents.
Surveys patients/families to determine level of satisfaction with agency services. Documents findings and notifies appropriate supervisor of any dis-satisfied customers.

The above statements are only meant to be a representative summary of the major duties and responsibilities performed by incumbents of this job. The incumbents may be requested to perform job related tasks other than those stated in this description.

Minimum of two years' experience preferably in-home health or health care, or graduation from a one or two-year business college preferred.
Aptitude or computer data entry and use of current software systems.
Ability to accurately manage detailed information.
Good communication skills.
Strong organizational skills and ability to multitask.
Reliable Car
Driver License

Solid analytical and problem solving skills; ability to communicate effectively
Must be able to work effectively in a highly dynamic team environment and assist all groups as needed
Responsibilities:
Solid analytical and problem solving skills; ability to communicate effectively
Must be able to work effectively in a highly dynamic team environment and assist all groups as needed
Requirement:
Solid analytical and problem solving skills; ability to communicate effectively
Must be able to work effectively in a highly dynamic team environment and assist all groups as needed
FullDescriptions:
Date: Sep 18, 2019
Location: CO - Denver, US, 80202
Location(s): CO - Denver

Are you looking for an exciting job where you can put your skills, talents and education to work at a company you can feel proud to be a part of? Do you want a workplace that will challenge you and offer you opportunities to learn and grow? A professional position at Xcel Energy could be just what you’re looking for.


Position Summary
Serves as diagnostician and solution provider for data, information and business process-related challenges. Responsible for representing technical expertise in specific data domains and incorporating governance into daily activities. Provides expertise in the integration of data related to business processes. Demonstrates good judgment in selecting methods and techniques for obtaining solutions. Teams with other analysts to extract, interpret, and perform advanced analytics.
Essential Responsibilities
Data Investigation and Extraction – Extracts data from operational systems and reporting databases using advanced SQL through a variety of reporting, data mining, and data management tools. Investigates complex table structures to identify data relationships and the location of required data. Validates accuracy of the results. Stratifies results to provide meaningful insights. Optimizes query performance through SQL tuning.
Advanced Analytics and Technologies – performs advanced analytics and data management as it pertains to specific job role. For analytics, this includes statistical and predictive analytics, business process mapping, gap analysis, and closed-loop analysis. For technologies, this includes advanced ETL, data modeling, management, quality, metadata, master data management, and strategic planning for effective information delivery methods including ad-hoc reports, standard reports, dashboards, scorecards, and data visualizations.
Work Management – Manages multiple tasks, with the ability to deal with ambiguity and shifting priorities. Communicates status and estimates clearly and timely to management and team members. Documents extraction methods, SQL coding, and reporting criteria to a level consistent with departmental standards. Conduct SQL peer-reviews as needed. Balances recurring reporting needs by transitioning ad-hoc reports and analysis into supported reporting tools. Perform data profiling and data cleansing tasks and help identify and troubleshoot data quality issues.
Customer Relationship – develops strong relationships with customers to understand business challenges and forge a partnering relationship for problem solving. Offers suggestions for improvement and/or further research into data findings or process issues. Clarifies customer requirements, manages expectations, and enhances business systems credibility, transparency, and partnership within Xcel and its vendors.
Continuing Education – takes a proactive approach to understanding industry and organization-specific business issues. Participates in structured and self-study training courses. Continually improves technical skills and learns new data sources.
Minimum Requirements
Bachelor’s degree in Business Administration or Information Technology or combination of education and related work experience providing equivalent knowledge. Five yrs of related experience and three yrs experience required in relational database reporting. Ability to understand complex data models, SQL query tools, and Business Objects. Ability to understand customer requirements and communicate clearly. Must also have experience identifying/developing end-to-end solutions to address changing business needs. Solid internal and external network of business and technology professionals at the manager level. Exceptional communication, time management and critical thinking abilities.

Preferred Qualifications
2-5 years of OSIsoft PI system administration experience working in a virtual environment. This includes installation and administration of the core PI system, data archives, and knowledge of various interfaces used in a corporate environment.
1-5 years of Windows OS server administration in an enterprise environment.
1 - 3 years of Asset Framework (AF) and Analytics experience
Working knowledge of IT/OT networking, communication protocols, and server hardware/software configuration experience
3 - 10 years of database/ or IT experience
Solid analytical and problem solving skills; ability to communicate effectively
Must be able to work effectively in a highly dynamic team environment and assist all groups as needed

As a leading combination electricity and natural gas energy company, Xcel Energy offers a comprehensive portfolio of energy-related products and services to 3.4 million electricity and 1.9 million natural gas customers across eight Western and Midwestern states. At Xcel Energy, we strive to be the preferred and trusted provider of the energy our customers need. If you’re ready to be a part of something big, we invite you to join our team.

Title: Paralegal and Contract Administrator
Requirement: This position requires excellent verbal and written communication and organizational skills with computer fluency in Microsoft Office including Word, Excel, Outlook, PowerPoint, etc.
FullDescriptions:
Paralegal and Contract Administrator
Position summary
MPS has an opening for a Paralegal and Contract Administrator position to provide support in Corporate Legal Department with a variety of legal duties, including contract database entry and administration, corporate governance, contract review, as well as other transactional and administrative matters. In addition to fulfilling the legal support function, you will have many opportunities to help shape and grow your role to further your career goals. You will be interfacing with various departments including Finance, Sales and Operations and outside counsel and auditors so excellent interpersonal skills are important. Candidates should be highly motivated individuals, with the ability to adapt and the willingness to learn unfamiliar tasks. Your responsibilities as a Paralegal and Contract Administrator will require a high level of integrity and discretion in handling confidential/proprietary information and professionalism in dealing with internal and external business partners.
Responsibilities:
Drafting, proofreading and initial review of routine contracts and a variety of other legal documents under the supervision of the General Counsel.
Work with various internal departments and external customers in response to timely requests for review, information and/or assistance related to contractual matters.
Help establish foreign subsidiaries and manage their annual compliance requirements, such as updating corporation status, registered agent and statement of information filings.
Maintain corporate contract database using ContractLogix and board minute books for subsidiaries.
Coordinate with the finance department and external auditors on responding to quarterly and annual audit and compliance requests, including proxy, SEC and SOX.
Perform administrative and clerical duties in support of the General Counsel and 3 attorneys of the legal department on an as needed basis, including, but not limited to, gathering appropriate approvals and signatures on contracts; maintenance of current and accurate corporate legal files (whether in electronic or paper format); composing business correspondence; filing.
Requirements
 This position requires excellent verbal and written communication and organizational skills with computer fluency in Microsoft Office including Word, Excel, Outlook, PowerPoint, etc.
 Successful candidate will have either a BA/BS or AA with related course work towards Paralegal Certification.
 3-5 years administrative experience in a corporate legal department or a law firm.
 Self-motivated with a positive attitude, ability to work well with others and have a desire to learn new areas of practice.
 Initiative to perform duties independently and well under pressure, with consistent high levels of accuracy, competency, and sound judgment.
 Ability to handle multiple projects at one time with continual changing priorities.
 Must be able to maintain high levels of confidentiality due to the nature of the work.
Location
Kirkland, WA

Title: Parent Specialist
FullDescriptions:
JOB SPECIFICATIONS:
Full-Time, Non-exempt, Twelve month work year
Occasional evening or weekend hours may be required
Employment, responsibilities, compensation, or any other factor may be affected by changes in governmental regulations, the agency’s contracts, or at agency discretion.
SALARY: :Range of Steps 1-4, $18.62/hr - $21.56/hr Initial Salary Placement is Step 1.:
DEADLINE TO APPLY: :Open until filled.
MINIMUM QUALIFICATIONS:
Experience working with parents and children
Ability to work well with people, sensitivity to the needs of children and families.
Good organization and clerical skills.
Basic computer skills.
Ability to correctly and effectively communicate in written and oral English.
A California driver’s license, daily use of an automobile and auto liability insurance.
PREFERRED QUALIFICATIONS:
Command of Spanish, Cantonese, Mandarin or Vietnamese strongly preferred.
BS/BS degree in Early Childhood Education or related field
Experience and or training in a Child Development program.
RESPONSIBILITIES AND DUTIES:
Manage assigned caseload.
Recruits families for the program.
Enrolls families, including certification and re-certification of eligibility for programs.
Works with all managers/supervisors and the parent to locate placement of the children.
Assists in maintaining eligibility list.
Manages all paperwork to verify family’s eligibility and need of services.
Responsible for the calculating of parent fees.
Review all attendance sheets /provider payment requests for children on caseload.
Assist parents to resolve problems with employers, schools, children and providers.
Coordinate social services, counseling, and health and special education referrals for parents.

Maintain current and accurate records in the database while maintaining confidentiality.
Assist with Special Events.
Assist the Department Coordinators and Division Administrator as needed.
Main knowledge of regulations for all applicable programs.
Represent Agency at meetings.
Other duties as assigned.
REPORTING RESPONSIBILITY:
Works under the direction of the Parent Specialist Supervisor.
BENEFITS: :Options for Learning provides flexible spending credits which can be applied toward the purchase of any of the following: Medical, Dental, Vision, Supplemental Life Insurance, Legal Assistance Plan, AFLAC, Dependent Care, 403(b) Retirement Savings, or a Cash-out option. Options for Learning also provides 9 paid holidays, Paid Personal Time Off, Basic Life Insurance coverage, Long Term Disability and an Employee Assistance Program at no additional cost to its employees.

Title: Parks Project/Program Manager III
FullDescriptions:
Summary
Be a part of King County Parks! King County Parks' mission is to steward, enhance and acquire parks to inspire healthy communities, and with 200 parks, 28,000 acres of open space and 175 miles of regional trails, King County Parks offers close-to-home recreational experiences for everyone.
The Parks Operations Section is seeking a Project/Program Manager III to maintain and enhance data resources, systems, platforms and related communications, and work toward supporting the business needs of the Parks Operations Section. This includes managing the Lucity corrective and preventive work order management system and the King County Parks Operations SharePoint site. This position will also serve as project manager to collaborate with diverse groups of customers for accomplishing a variety of projects that revolve around data management and business workflows.
Who May Apply: The position is open to all qualified candidates.
Apply on-line at: www.kingcounty.gov/jobs.

For additional information about the work we do in Parks, we invite you to view our King County Parks video: Parks Video

Please submit: a completed online King County application including supplemental questions, resume, and letter of interest detailing your background and what you and bring to this position.
Work Location: Parks Renton Shop, 3005 NE 4th, Renton WA 98056.
Work Schedule: This position is exempt from the provisions of the Fair Labor Standards Act and is not overtime eligible. The workweek is normally Monday through Friday.
Our ideal candidate will have the following competencies:
Business Insight: Applies knowledge of business and the marketplace to advance the organization's goals.
Technical Savvy: Anticipates and adopts innovations in business-building digital and technology applications.
Effective Communicator: Develops and delivers multi-mode communications that convey a clear understanding of the unique needs of the different audiences.
Optimizes Work Processes: Knows the most effective and efficient processes to get things done, with a focus on continuous improvement.
Passion for creativity and inspiring innovation.
Essential Functions of Position:
Develop and manage specific programs independently; this includes business workflows, databases or business information systems.
Manage program users, provide on-going training and technical support to staff. Develop training and reference materials for users and/or programs.
Serve as the technical expert to perform complex research, analysis and improvements. Serve as expert adviser for various program areas. Serve as liaison to key partners for accomplishing program objectives.
Develop and maintain data resources, including tailoring to user group needs. This includes creating record keeping systems, customizing views, queries and reports. Applying efficiency and accuracy when gathering and reporting information.
Establish work flows, document business processes around products and services for facilitating operational practices. Establish and communicate change management processes where needed.
Perform administrator or co-administrator responsibilities for database or business information systems. Coordinate system maintenance; sustain program integrity.
Apply project management skills to assigned projects; including from development, implementation, and execution to monitoring and/or closing.
Develop and oversee budget for a specific unit or project.
Serve as lead for various programs. Conduct technical meetings. Coordinate review/comment processes related to project or program, develop and articulate analysis.
May supervise or assign work to other staff; provide performance evaluation information for other staff; serve as mentors to other staff. Engage with staff and resolve issues/disputes.
Communicate in wide variety of settings. Write reports, stories, correspondence, training materials, etc.
Perform other duties as assigned.
The ideal candidate will have at least three years of progressively responsible experience and/or equivalent combination of education and experience demonstrating knowledge and application of data analysis, reporting, presentation, project management, and staff leadership. The candidate will also have:
Excellent organizational skills and attention to detail; ability to work on several projects simultaneously and complete projects within specified deadlines.
Ability to research, analyze, interpret recommend and synthesize complex organizational data to resolve issues and recommend improvements to existing processes.
Demonstrated ability to oversee, write, and present complex reports for technical and non-technical audiences.
Strong presentation skills with the ability to initiate action.
Demonstrated ability to train and motivate others.
Demonstrated experience with complex project management including developing roles, milestones, and timelines, and coordinating communication and outcomes with external and internal teams
Demonstrated ability to effectively problem solve and apply good judgment and initiative.
Ability to maintain confidentiality and use discretion when handling sensitive information.
Demonstrated experience applying equity and social justice principals and principles and practices in a government or business setting.
Demonstrated ability to communicate and work with diverse populations and interest groups.
Ability to apply excellent customer service skills both orally and in writing, including the ability to provide professional and courteous service.
Proficiency in Microsoft Office 365 including Word, Excel, Outlook, SharePoint, OneDrive and Microsoft CRM.Experience with Lucity highly desired.
Strong data analytics skills and knowledge of database structures.
The Most Competitive Candidates Will Have:
Demonstrated experience in administrating systems needs around maintenance management systems, such as Lucity.
Demonstrated knowledge of operations and maintenance management, such as understanding business practices and resources for supporting services and goods in parks operations or other public service agency.
Strong understanding of front-end and back-end of government software systems.
Strong team leadership experience.
For more information regarding this recruitment, please contact: Patty Jurgens at patty.jurgens@kingcounty.gov or 206-477-4572.

Title: Part-Time Family Activity Center Program Assistant
FullDescriptions:
Great Lakes was founded in 1977 to provide a broad range of information management, research and consulting services to the government and public sector. Our initial focus was primarily research and evaluation services. In 2000, due to the addition and growth of our staffing function; the principals of Great Lakes founded Diversified Care Management, a sister company that specializes in staffing of direct service functions to the public and non-profit sector.
We are seeking a Part-Time Family Activity Center Program Assistant who is flexible and able to work in various positions within the Allegheny County Jail’s Re-Entry Services department. This includes, but is not limited to, working with the children of incarcerated parents, maintaining spaces within the jail for family contact visits, data entry work related to programs and services within the jail, sorting inmate requests for programming and assisting in creating waitlists for classes within the jail. Evening and weekend work is mandatory. Additional responsibilities will include:
Assisting with all programming as designated by the Administrator of Re-Entry Services.
Creating activities for children/families on the weekends
One-on-one activities with the children on the weekends from 9:30am-3pm
Developing educational projects for school-age children.
Working collaboratively with the Carnegie Library
Preparing room and activities for each day’s planned activities
Collecting and transporting brochures, supplies and activity materials.
Maintaining supplies
Maintaining book donations
Maintaining on-site equipment
Supervising volunteers on-site
Providing support to volunteers
Assisting with creating and running reports for the Family Activity Center.
Entering weekend count of visitors to the center.
Entering data into the Jail Collaborative database (ACJC).
Sorting through inmate requests for Re-Entry programming and services.
Assisting Re-Entry Analyst in creating waitlists for jail classes and services.
Associates Degree from an accredited college/university is preferred, plus 1 year of work experience, particularly working with children; Previous knowledge of the stages of child development is desired. The ideal candidate will be a self-starter with a strong work ethic, good organizational skills and excellent interpersonal and communication skills. This position requires a flexible work schedule of up to 30 hours and work hours depend on Activity Center Hours. Evening and weekend hours are mandatory. Candidate must have proficient computer skills (Word, Excel, Database experience) and be physically capable of lifting up to 30 pounds; on-site equipment and supplies.
AN EQUAL OPPORTUNITY EMPLOYER - M/F/V/D

Title: Part-time Registered Nurse Assessment Coordinator (RNAC) - Vincentian Home (North Hills)
FullDescriptions:
Part-time Registered Nurse Assessment Coordinator (RNAC)
Shift: 20 hours per week
Location: Vincentian Home
The primary purpose of the RNAC job position is to coordinate and certify completion of the resident assessments. Such performance must be in accordance with current federal and state standards, guidelines and regulations that govern the facility and ensure that the highest degree of quality service is maintained at all times.
Essential Duties And Responsibilities:
1. Conducts and coordinates the RAI process including the MDS, CAA and Interdisciplinary Care Plan.
2. Oversees timely and accurate RAI completion and submission.
3. Certifies the completion of the assessment (Fed Reg 42 CFR 483.20).
4. Follows the RAI Utilization Guidelines.
5. Works in collaboration with the Interdisciplinary team including: Nursing, Rehab, Restorative Nursing, Social Service, Dietary, Activities, Admission, and Billing.
6. Provides documentation forms to support data for the assessment period.
7. Assures supporting documentation is accurate and complete.
8. Evaluates clinical information to determine best Assessment Reference Date.
9. Establishes the OBRA and PPS assessment schedule for all residents by completing:
10. Monthly calendar for goal planning meetings, to include the Annual and Quarterly MDS schedule with Assessment Reference Date and Date of Completion,
11. Weekly schedule of all MDS’s due with Assessment Reference Dates and Completion Dates for each goal planning meeting for the next week, including Admission and Significant Changes,
12. Copies and distributes to the Interdisciplinary Team.
13. Attends and co-chairs weekly goal planning meetings with Social Service staff.
14. Provides leadership and guidance in goal planning meetings for establishment of realistic goals for all residents.
15. Ensures that the MDS and CAA are completed and that the CAA summary is written and signed when care planning is completed. Oversees the development of the resident’s individualized Care Plan.
16. Oversees/completes data entry of MDS.
17. Updates the 672/802 with each MDS.
18. Provides education to the staff on proper completion of the MDS, CAA, and required documentation, including significant change criteria.
19. Electronic submission of all required data to the central database according to the CMS instructions found in the Long Term Care Facility User’s Manual, and following federal and state guidelines.
20. Monitors the MA or non-MA status of the resident at any point during the resident’s stay, completing an MA Change form accordingly.
21. Reviews Validation Reports for timeliness and accuracy; identifies problems and makes corrections promptly.
22. Provides MDS Resource Utilization Group (RUG) information to the Billing department necessary for the billing process.
23. Monitors the case mix index and keeps the Administrator informed of trends that may potentially impact reimbursement.
24. Checks CMI report for accuracy, makes necessary corrections, and submits to the Administrator for her Signature on the Picture Dates (Feb, May, Aug, Nov).
25. Coordinates the care and services for each resident including Medicare Prospective Payment System Part A SNF, HMO skilled level of care, Medical Assistance and Private Pay.
26. Performs all other duties as assigned by supervisor.

Education/Experience:
1. Current licensure to practice as a Registered Nurse in the Commonwealth of Pennsylvania in good standing required.
2. A minimum of two years experience as a Registered Nurse in a long-term care environment preferred.

 EOE

Title: Part-Time Webmaster
Responsibilities:
Design, develop, implement, and maintain custom web and database applications for internal and external use.
Performs regular updates of pages and servers to maintain timeliness of data and security.
Maintains direct channels of communication with the Director of Technology and Central Office administrators.
Receives input, feedback, and advice concerning the content and display of all web-based resources from the Director of Technology and Central Office administrators.

Title: Patient Family Relations Specialist
Responsibilities:
Shares responsibility for the coverage of Patient/Family Relations Office phones, pagers, and email during operational hours
Responds to patient, family, staff queries / feedback
Triages patient, family, and staff queries appropriately and efficiently
Responds to urgent patient/family needs as requested
Completes documentation related to patient/family/staff encounters to gather pertinent information
Enters case summary and related information into the PFR database
FullDescriptions:
Overview
Located in Boston and the surrounding communities, Dana-Farber Cancer Institute brings together world renowned clinicians, innovative researchers and dedicated professionals, allies in the common mission of conquering cancer, HIV/AIDS and related diseases. Combining extremely talented people with the best technologies in a genuinely positive environment, we provide compassionate and comprehensive care to patients of all ages; we conduct research that advances treatment; we educate tomorrow's physician/researchers; we reach out to underserved members of our community; and we work with amazing partners, including other Harvard Medical School-affiliated hospitals.

The Patient / Family Relations (P/FR) Specialist serves as an integral member of the Quality and Patient Safety Department (QPS), participating in various aspects of patient advocacy, which includes helping to personalize and humanize the hospital experience.

The P/FR Specialist will support the Patient / Family Relations program at the Institute, including the outpatient and inpatient locations, by serving as a liaison between patients (adult and pediatric), families, and staff by ensuring an effective complaint and grievance process. He/she will engage in intake and triage of patient complaints and requests. The P/FR Specialist will ensure a coordinated and timely response, in accordance with state and federal regulatory guidelines and Institute policy, to patients/families who have expressed a concern, complaint, grievance, compliment, question and / or a request regarding care, treatment or services at Dana-Farber Cancer Institute (DFCI).

In addition, the P/FR Specialist will help to ensure ongoing monitoring of DFCI’s compliance with federal laws prohibiting discrimination against patients, including applicable rules under the Patient Protection and Affordable Care Act (“ACA”) and Americans with Disabilities Act (“ADA”). In addition, the P/FR Specialist will be available to staff to assist with challenging patients / families or to provide guidance in the utilization of other Institute resources (e.g., the Division of Social Work, Psychosocial Oncology, or Patient & Family Programs & Services).
The P/FR Specialist will be available during regular business hours.
Responsibilities
Patient / Family / Staff communications
Shares responsibility for the coverage of Patient/Family Relations Office phones, pagers, and email during operational hours
Responds to patient, family, staff queries / feedback
Triages patient, family, and staff queries appropriately and efficiently
Responds to urgent patient/family needs as requested
Completes documentation related to patient/family/staff encounters to gather pertinent information
Enters case summary and related information into the PFR database
Complaint/Grievance Management
Assists in the coordination, facilitation, and accurate documentation of cases from intake to resolution
Works closely with P/FR Manager, along with Department / Unit leaders to write / review / edit / format response letters to patients / families
Collaborates with P/FR Manager, Risk Management staff and Medical Director of Patient Safety on case reviews
Interfaces closely with affiliates, Brigham and Women’s Hospital and Boston Children’s Hospital, to insure coordinated investigation and feedback
Patient/Family Relations Program
Assists in maintaining the Service Recovery Program inventory and log
Tracks Service Recoveries in the PFR database
Supports Patient Experience initiatives
Participates in Institute-wide committees
Participates in the orientation of new staff
Interacts with Institute staff and departments, such as but not limited to Social Work, Nursing, Psychosocial Oncology & Palliative Care, Volunteer Services, Medical, Surgical and Pediatric Oncology
Responds to requests for information related to or witnessing Advance Directives (e.g., health care proxy)
Assists in the coordination of PFR activities, education, and training programs
ADA/ACA Program
Facilitate compliance with the rules required under the ACA and ADA to prevent discriminatio
Ensure DFCI’s timely response to patient disability accommodation requests and discrimination grievances.
Serve as a resource for administrators and staff about the ACA and ADA.
When appropriate, along with DFCI’s Office of General Counsel, serve as a liaison to the Department of Health and Human Services Office of Civil Rights (“OCR”) for issues regarding discrimination generally.
Maintains Department and Institute service standards.

All other duties as assigned.
Qualifications
Bachelor’s degree required. 3-5 years healthcare experience demonstrating excellent customer service, writing and problem-solving skills. Ability to communicate with all levels of staff and appropriately manage challenging situations in real-time. Ability to demonstrate flexibility, participate in and provide customer service training and guidance to staff and clinicians

Dana-Farber Cancer Institute is an equal opportunity employer and affirms the right of every qualified applicant to receive consideration for employment without regard to race, color, religion, sex, gender identity or expression, national origin, sexual orientation, genetic information, disability, age, ancestry, military service, protected veteran status, or other groups as protected by law.

Receives requests to schedule procedures from physician offices and patients and schedules the procedure according to the availability of the various departments
Other duties as assigned.

Title: PEI Prog Spec V
FullDescriptions:
The Program Specialist V serves as a research and evaluation specialist for the DFPS Division of Prevention and Early Intervention. The position is selected by and reports to the PEI Division Administrator for Research and Evaluation and coordinates research and data analysis activities for the Division.. This position is responsible for tracking, measuring and recording performance reports and other statistical data by conducting research, collecting data, and providing training and technical assistance on the impact of child abuse and neglect prevention programs being offered or developed by the Division. The goal of this work is to support prevention programming by increasing data-driven decision-making; promoting evidence-based practices and programs; and increasing stakeholder understanding of data collection, entry, and analysis. The position performs advanced (senior-level) consultative and technical assistance work involving the development and implementation of program goals and objectives. The position coordinates with external contractors to review and evaluate their findings and reports and to stay informed of current research; works closely with PEI stakeholders to improve their understanding of data entry, data collection, outputs, outcomes, and impacts; coordinates with stakeholders, external and internal evaluators, other DFPS divisions, and other state and federal agencies on research and evaluation team projects; identifies and creates training content for contractors and communities. The position also assists with program planning and coordination of meetings, site visits, IT systems, databases, and trainings; and trains, leads, and/or prioritizes the workload of others. The position works under limited supervision, with considerable latitude for the use of initiative and independent judgment.


Essential Job Functions:
PEI Research and Evaluation Specialist V


Data Analysis


This position analyzes, implements, and documents program data; collects, compiles and analyzes research data; oversees the collection, organization, analysis, and preparation of materials in response to requests for program data information requests and data reports; completes required administrative and performance reports, studies, and specialized projects; studies and analyzes operations and problems and prepares reports of findings and recommendations; designs surveys and questionnaires for data collection; utilizes outside data sources; develops data visualizations; including infographics, maps, charts, and tables; prepares and distributes of departmental statistical reports on a regular and ad hoc basis; and performs related work as assigned. (35%)


Training and Technical Assistance


This position trains and supervises staff and contractors in entry and retrieval of data; explains data and analysis in a way that is understandable to those with limited data knowledge or experience; prepares and provides presentations for the Legislature, the Commissioner, professional organizations, government entities and the general public; uses data from administrative sources, focus groups, surveys and structured interviews to help contractors and staff make needed adjustments; researches and consults on evidence-based program review; provides training and technical assistance on the use of data, data collection, database usage, report usage, and evidence-based programming for program improvement; identifies and anticipates data needs of program areas through up-to-date knowledge of departmental programs and activities; communicates external and internal research findings to contractors and staff; trains and leads the work of others; conducts online and in-person trainings with internal and external staff; and performs related work as assigned. (35%)


Collaboration


Collaborates with external and internal stakeholders on the development and design of research and evaluation projects. Supports PEI leadership in making and sustaining needed cultural, process, and organizational policy. Coordinates and synthesizes internal stakeholder feedback on third party evaluations. Provides excellent customer service to database and report users; collaborates with the research and evaluation team on database design and enhancement, quality assurance, continuous quality improvement, data-driven decision-making, and evaluation projects and trainings; and performs related work as assigned. (30%)



Knowledge Skills Abilities:
Knowledge of statistical concepts and methods and their application to research analyses; of data collection design, evaluation, and research methods, principles, techniques and philosophies.


General knowledge of the child welfare system and how the system works.


Knowledge of DFPS, state and federal, and external databases such as American FactFinder, the State Demographic Center, Kids Count, County Health Rankings


Knowledge of evidence-based programming, evidence-informed programming, promising practices, and associated clearinghouses and ranking tools.


Skill in conducting qualitative and quantitative research in the use of a computer and applicable software and in using statistical tools and programs.


Skill in identifying measures or indicators of program performance including developing logic models and theories of change.


Skill in using computers, software, statistical tools (including but not limited to Excel, SPSS, SAS, SQL, R, or STATA), mapping tools, and databases.


Skills in communication and organization with the ability to communicate complex information orally and in writing in a way that is understandable for multiple different audiences.


Skill in synthesizing research findings, data, and best practices.


Ability to creatively problem solve, including accessing needed resources from multiple areas and sources and helping management think outside the box in developing solutions.


Ability to understand and conduct basic data analysis, use descriptive statistics and use qualitative methods (focus groups, surveys, etc).


Ability to gather, assemble, correlate, and analyze facts; to devise solutions to problems; to market programs; to prepare reports; to develop, evaluate, and interpret policies and procedures.


Ability to communicate effectively; and to train, lead, assign, and/or prioritize the work of others.


Ability to develop statistical reports to compile and analyze statistical data and to train others to use data in their everyday practice.

None
